026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool;
027
028import com.sun.tools.javac.util.Context;
029import com.sun.tools.javac.util.JavacMessages;
030
031import java.io.PrintWriter;
032import java.util.Optional;
033import java.util.ResourceBundle;
034import java.util.spi.ToolProvider;
035
036/**
037 * An implementation of the {@link java.util.spi.ToolProvider ToolProvider} SPI,
038 * providing access to JDK documentation tool, javadoc.
039 *
040 * @since 9
041 */
042// This is currently a stand-alone top-level class so that it can easily be excluded
043// from interims builds of javadoc, used while building JDK.
044public class JavadocToolProvider implements ToolProvider {
045
046    @Override
047    public String name() {
048        return "javadoc";
049    }
050
051    // @Override - commented out due to interim builds of javadoc with JDKs <
052    // 19.
053    public Optional<String> description() {
054        JavacMessages messages = JavacMessages.instance(new Context());
055        messages.add(locale -> ResourceBundle.getBundle(
056            "org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool.resources.javadoc", locale));
057        return Optional.of(messages.getLocalizedString("javadoc.description"));
058    }
059
060    @Override
061    public int run(PrintWriter out, PrintWriter err, String... args) {
062        return Main.execute(args, out, err);
063    }
064}
